jdk.notebook.restart.kernel.short.title: Restart
jdk.delete.cache: Delete Oracle Java extension cache for this workspace
jdk.open.userDir: Open Oracle Java extension cache directory for this workspace
jdk.configuration.specifyJdk.description: Specifies JDK for the Oracle Visual Studio Code Extension
jdk.configuration.specifyProjectJdk.desc: Specifies the JDK on which user's project will be run. Defaults to the value of jdk.jdkhome
jdk.configuration.verbose.description: Enables verbose messages from the Oracle Visual Studio Code Extension
jdk.configuration.userdir.description: Keep settings and caches as 'global' or 'local' per workspace?
jdk.configuration.userdir.description.sh: Share data between all workspaces (more effective)
jdk.configuration.userdir.description.is: Each workspace has its own data (more isolated)
jdk.configuration.userdir.deprecationMes: Separate userdir for each workspace is the default behaviour
jdk.configuration.javadoc.timeout.descri: Timeout (in milliseconds) for loading Javadoc in code completion (-1 for unlimited)
jdk.configuration.formatterSettings.desc: Path to the file containing exported formatter settings
jdk.configuration.hints.preferences.desc: Path to the file containing exported hints preferences
jdk.configuration.organiseImports.descri: Enable organize imports action on a document save
jdk.configuration.organiseImports.sortin: Groups of import statements (specified by their package prefixes) and their sorting order. Import statements within a group are ordered alphabetically
jdk.configuration.countForUsingStarImpor: Class count to use a star-import
jdk.configuration.countForUsingStaticSta: Members count to use a static star-import
jdk.configuration.serverVmOptions.descri: Specifies extra VM arguments used to launch the Java Language Server
jdk.configuration.disableNbJavac.descrip: Advanced option: disable nb-javac library, javac from the selected JDK will be used. The selected JDK must be at least JDK 25.
jdk.configuration.disableProjectSearchLi: Advanced option: disable limits on searching in containing folders for project information.
jdk.configuration.telemetry.enabled.desc: Allow the Oracle Java extension for Visual Studio Code ("JVSCE") to collect and send anonymous technical data commonly known as "telemetry data" to Oracle to help improve the Java platform. No personal information nor source code is collected. You may refer to the data collection and privacy policy for JVSCE at https://github.com/oracle/javavscode/blob/main/vscode/TELEMETRY.md
jdk.configuration.telemetry.enabled.mark: Allow the Oracle Java extension for Visual Studio Code ("*JVSCE*") to collect and send anonymous technical data commonly known as "*telemetry data*" to Oracle to help improve the Java platform. No personal information nor source code is collected. You may refer to the data collection and privacy policy for JVSCE at [TELEMETRY.md](https://github.com/oracle/javavscode/blob/main/vscode/TELEMETRY.md).
jdk.debugger.configuration.mainClass.des: Absolute path to the program main class
jdk.debugger.configuration.mainClass.mar:
Main class specification. Supported formats:
 - an absolute path
 - a path relative to any of the workspace folders
 - a fully qualified name of a class.
jdk.debugger.configuration.classPaths.de: The classpaths for launching the JVM.
jdk.debugger.configuration.console.descr: The specified console to launch the program.
Single argument for the Java VM
jdk.debugger.configuration.cwd.descripti: Working directory for the program execution
jdk.debugger.configuration.env.descripti: Environment variables for the program execution
jdk.debugger.configuration.launchConfigu: Mode and default behaviour for launch
jdk.debugger.configuration.attach.hostNa: Host name or IP address to which to attach
jdk.debugger.configuration.attach.port.d: Port number to which to attach
jdk.debugger.configuration.attach.shared: Shared memory name of the debuggee
jdk.debugger.configuration.attach.listen: Listen for the debuggee to attach
jdk.debugger.configuration.completion.wa: When code completion takes longer than this specified time (in milliseconds), there will be a warning produced (-1 to disable)
jdk.notebook.classpath.description: The specific class-paths for use in Java notebooks. Defaults to class-paths of the project context, when empty.
jdk.notebook.modulepath.description: The specific module-paths for use in Java notebooks. Defaults to module-paths of the project context, when empty.
jdk.notebook.addmodules.description: The specific modules for use in Java notebooks. Defaults to modules of the project context, when empty.
jdk.notebook.enablePreview.description: Enable the use of Java preview features in Java notebooks
jdk.notebook.implicitImports.description: List of elements to implicitly import in Java notebooks. Defaults to star-imports of java.util, java.io and java.math packages, when empty.
jdk.notebook.implicitImports.markdownDes: List of elements to implicitly import in Java notebooks. Defaults to star-imports of `java.util`, `java.io` and `java.math` packages, when empty.
jdk.notebook.projects.mapping.descriptio: Mapping of Java notebook paths to the path of the project that provides it context.
jdk.notebook.vmOptions.description: The specific Java VM options for use in Java notebooks. These options are added in addition to the project configuration, including class-path, module-path, preview features, and added modules.
jdk.configuration.java.completion.commit: Specifies the characters that trigger accepting a code completion suggestion. For example, to accept suggestions when typing a dot (.), set this to ["."]
jdk.configurationSnippets.name: Launch Java App
jdk.configurationSnippets.label: Java+: Launch Java Application
jdk.configurationSnippets.description: Launch a Java Application in debug mode
jdk.configuration.inlay.enabled.descript: Enable or disable various inline hints.
jdk.configuration.inlay.enabled.enum.cha: Show return types of chained methods
